definition: to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips

sentences.english: Conclusion The above procedure is necessary for the ankle sprains with the injury of the common peroneal nerve.
sentences.chinese: 結論踝扭傷出現腓總神經損傷者應作探查鬆解減壓術。

sentences.english: The player was sidelined with a sprained ankle.
sentences.chinese: 這運動員因踝部扭傷而退場。

sentences.english: Pulled muscles and twisted ankles are the downside of sports and exercise.
sentences.chinese: 運動和訓練中拉傷肌肉和扭傷關節已呈下降趨勢。

sentences.english: Joan sprained foot of all assistance, whole change, rental cottage to all the tiantai.
sentences.chinese: 瓊扭傷腳得全協助，對全改觀，出租天台小屋給全。

sentences.english: Scott fell over and sprained his ankle .
sentences.chinese: 斯科特摔倒了，扭傷了踝骨。

sentences.english: A sprain is an injury to a ligament caused by excessive stretching.
sentences.chinese: 扭傷是由於過度拉伸而引起的韌帶受傷。

sentences.english: He sprained his ankle when playing football.
sentences.chinese: 他踢足球時扭傷了腳脖子。

sentences.english: Earlier studies found that running shoes could increase the risk for plantar fasciitis and ankle sprains.
sentences.chinese: 早期調查發現跑鞋會增加患上腳疣和腳踝扭傷的風險。

sentences.english: As I was getting on the bus, I slipped and hurt my foot.
sentences.chinese: 我在上公共汽車時滑倒了，把腳扭傷了。

sentences.english: Why the crural sprain of my Mom about the same two months had still done not have?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我媽的腳扭傷了差不多兩個月了還沒好？

sentences.english: For recent injuries such as sprains and headaches, cold compresses are recommended.
sentences.chinese: 對最近的一些傷病，例如扭傷和頭痛，建議進行冷敷。

sentences.english: On occasion, fractures may occur along with thumb sprains.
sentences.chinese: 斷裂偶爾也會伴隨拇指扭傷發生。

sentences.english: Swelling and pain with redness or ecchymosis in the injured area because of the obstruction.
sentences.chinese: 扭傷局部因瘀阻而腫脹疼痛，傷處肌膚出現紅腫青紫。

sentences.english: He sprained his wrist while playing a ball game, so the doctor suggested wax therapy.
sentences.chinese: 扭傷了手腕，醫生建議他蠟療一下試試。

sentences.english: He hurt his left ankle in the broad jump.

definition: to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
